  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • populateTableView

      public void populateTableView()
      This method populates the scheduleTable when the ScheduleScreen is first initialized. Lambda Function #1 This method also uses a lambda function to format the dateColumn into a format that is far more readable. The lambda function improves the code because this function only needs to exist in this one spot to help format the date.

    • exitProgram

      public void exitProgram(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method closes the program, which will also close the database connection via the main() method ending
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - is unused and was auto-generated

    • deleteAppointment

      public void deleteAppointment()
      This method displays an error message to the user if they have not selected an Appointment from the TableView. Otherwise, it uses an SQL update to delete the Appointment and then refresh the TableView to reflect the change.

    • showUpdateAppointmentScreen

      public void showUpdateAppointmentScreen()
      This method creates a popup window where the user can append an Appointment object in the database. If no appointment is selected, an error message is displayed.

    • showDetailsScreen

      public void showDetailsScreen()
      This method creates a popup window showing the full details of a selected Appointment. The data is passed to the new window via the static selectedAppointment Appointment object. If no Appointment is selected, an error message is displayed.

    • showNewAppointmentScreen

      public void showNewAppointmentScreen()
      This method creates a popup window where users can add a new appointment to the database

    • showScheduleScreen

      public void showScheduleScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is unused here because the program is already displaying the ScheduleScreen
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - is unused and was auto-generated

    • showCustomerScreen

      public void showCustomerScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method loads the CustomerScreen in the existing stage for a cleaner UI look
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - is used to inform the method of the correct stage in which to load the new Customer scene
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getSelectedAppointment

      public static Appointment getSelectedAppointment()
      This method is used to pass an Appointment object to other controllers either to view details or make changes to the Appointment
      Returns:
      returns the selected Appointment object in the TableView

    • setSelectedAppointment

      public static void setSelectedAppointment(Appointment appointment)

    • showAllAppointments

      public void showAllAppointments()
      This method uses an SQL query to set the TableView to show all appointments in the database

    • showMonthAppointments

      public void showMonthAppointments()
      This method uses an SQL query to set the Tableview to show only appointments that occur in the next 30 days

    • showWeekAppointments

      public void showWeekAppointments()
      This method uses an SQL query to set the Tableview to show only appointments that occur in the next 7 days

    • confirmDelete

      public boolean confirmDelete(String title, String content)
      This method is used to create a popup window when a user wants to delete an Appointment object
      Parameters:
      title - sets the title of the window
      content - sets the message that will be displayed in the window
      Returns:
      value is used to determine if the user clicked OK to delete or CANCEL to cancel the deletion

    • popupMessageDialogue

      public void popupMessageDialogue(String title, String content)
      This method is used to create a generic popup window to display a message to the user
      Parameters:
      title - sets the title of the window
      content - sets the message that will be displayed in the window

    • firstLoginPopup

      public void firstLoginPopup()
      This method is only called the very first time the ScheduleScreen is initialized. It informs the user if they have any or no appointments that occur in the next 15 minutes, and it takes into account their timezone.

    • errorMessageDialogue

      public void errorMessageDialogue(String title, String content)
      This method displays an error message to the user if something goes wrong
      Parameters:
      title - sets the title of the window
      content - sets the message that will be displayed in the window

    • dragWindow

      public void dragWindow(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method allows a user to drag an undecorated window around their computer screen
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - is used to determine when they drag their mouse

    • clickWindow

      public void clickWindow(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method detects when a user has clicked an undecorated window that they wish to drag around their computer screen
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - detects when the mouse is clicked
